result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory M Backus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Cash bail applied to fine, paid in full.

Restitution to victim was paid prior to sentencing.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: filed by the state
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Gregory M Backus in court with Attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Defendant has paid restitution in full.  Attorney Huppertz makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  FINE:  $605.00 to be paid in 60 days, alternate 12 days jail if not paid.
Dated 10/20/15, from Atty Huppertz to Judge Carter, with attached treatment letter.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-28-2015 08:30 am

Attorney Matthew Huppertz in court.   Defendant Gregory M Backus did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Hupperz states that restitution has been paid in full, and the Defendant has 4 more treatment classes to complete. Atty Huppertz requests another plea/sentencing hearing 45 days out. Court adjourns. Bail remains as fixed.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 11, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
